subject: Home & DIY
title: Why Your Smart Home Needs a Separate Network
description: A 60-second lesson on Why Your Smart Home Needs a Separate Network.

hook.text: A hacked smart bulb can give attackers access to your whole networkâ€”including laptops, phones, and banking apps.

buildup.text: Cheap IoT devices often have weak security: default passwords, no encryption, and no firmware updates after sale.

discovery.text: Network segmentation puts IoT devices on a guest VLAN. Even if hacked, they can't reach your personal devices.

twist.text: In 2019, hackers breached a casino's VIP database through an internet-connected fish tank thermometer on the network.

climax.text: Most routers support guest networks. Putting IoT devices on one takes 10 minutes and slashes your attack surface.

punchline.text: Your smart bulb is the weakest link in your security.

quiz.question: How did hackers access a casino's database in a notable 2019 breach?
options: Through an internet-connected fish tank thermometer on the same network
By hacking the casino's smart security cameras
Through the Wi-Fi in a smart slot machine
